Comment 15: 
Rewriting the runtime has opportunities for asymptotic efficiency improvements.  The
effort spent improving tooling benefits users and developers and there is less tooling
to maintain.  This is also true for data structures used by the runtime.

I am not sure about needing to subset the language to implement the runtime.  While
runtime code might be constrained in what features can be used, this is true whether it
is written in a high- or low-level language.
